intro: Linaria warionis, commonly known as the common toadflax, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Linaria warionis is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats.
